sentence.text: Transgender Women Living with HIV Frequently Take Antiretroviral Therapy and/or Feminizing Hormone Therapy Differently Than Prescribed Due to Drug-Drug Interaction Concerns.
Both hormone therapy (HT) and antiretroviral therapy (ART) can be lifesaving for transgender women (TW) living with HIV, but each has side effects and potential drug-drug interactions (DDI)
We assessed how concerns about HT-ART interactions affect treatment adherence
This study used a cross-sectional survey of TW (n = 87) in Los Angeles, CA
Fifty-four percent were living with HIV; 64% used HT
Only 49% of TW living with HIV discussed ART-HT DDI with their provider; 40% reported not taking ART (12%), HT (12%), or both (16%) as directed due to DDI concerns
Imperfect HT/ART use and limited provider communication suggests a need for improved HT-ART integration
